docs.title: Welcome to exampleDocs
docs.text: This is your documentation site built with MkDocs and GitHub Pages.

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
• 📖 Getting Started - Learn how to use this template
  • 🎨 Examples - See all available Markdown features
  • 📝 Changelog - View version history

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• ✅ Built with MkDocs
  • ✅ Deployed automatically to GitHub Pages
  • ✅ Material theme with dark/light mode
  • ✅ Full-text search
  • ✅ Code syntax highlighting
  • ✅ Responsive design
  • ✅ Easy to customize and extend

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
1. Edit this page - Customize the content to match your project
  2. Add your docs - Create new markdown files in the docs/ directory
  3. Update navigation - Edit mkdocs.yml to add pages to the menu
  4. Push changes - GitHub Actions will automatically deploy your site!

docs.title: What's Included
docs.text:
This template includes:

  • Example documentation pages
  • GitHub Actions workflow for automatic deployment
  • Issue templates for bug reports and feature requests
  • Contributing guidelines
  • MIT License

Ready to start? Check out the Getting Started Guide!

docs.title: Changelog
docs.text: All notable changes to this template will be documented in this file.

docs.title: Added
docs.text:
• Initial template setup with MkDocs and Material theme
  • GitHub Actions workflow for automatic deployment
  • Example documentation pages
  • Getting started guide
  • Markdown examples page
  • Issue templates for bug reports and feature requests
  • MIT License
  • Contributing guidelines

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Automatic GitHub Pages deployment
  • Material theme with dark/light mode
  • Full-text search
  • Code syntax highlighting
  • Responsive design
  • Edit on GitHub links

docs.title: Markdown Examples
docs.text: This page demonstrates various Markdown features available in this MkDocs setup.

docs.title: Basic Code Block
docs.text:
def hello_world():
    print("Hello, World!")
    return True

docs.title: Code Block with Line Numbers
docs.text:
def fibonacci(n):
    if n <= 1:
        return n
    return fibonacci(n-1) + fibonacci(n-2)

docs.title: Admonitions
docs.text:
Note

This is a note admonition. Use it for important information.

Tip

This is a tip. Great for helpful hints!

Warning

This is a warning. Use for cautionary information.

Danger

This is a danger box. Use for critical warnings.

docs.title: Collapsible Sections
docs.text:
Click to expand

This content is hidden by default. Click the header to expand it.

You can put any content here, including:

  • Lists
  • Code blocks
  • Images
  • Links

docs.title: Tabs
docs.text:
PythonJavaScriptBash 
print("Hello from Python!")

console.log("Hello from JavaScript!");

echo "Hello from Bash!"

docs.title: Task Lists
docs.text:
• Completed task
  • Incomplete task
  • Another completed task
  • Another incomplete task

docs.title: Emojis
docs.text: This setup supports emojis!

docs.title: Tables
docs.text: Feature Status Notes MkDocs ✅ Working Material Theme ✅ Configured GitHub Pages ✅ Auto-deploy Search ✅ Enabled

docs.title: Footnotes
docs.text: Here's a sentence with a footnote1.

docs.title: Inline Code Highlighting
docs.text: You can highlight inline code: `python:print("hi")` or just plain `code`.

docs.title: Links
docs.text:
• MkDocs Documentation
  • Material for MkDocs

docs.title: Block Quotes
docs.text:
This is a block quote. Use it to highlight important quotes or citations.

It can span multiple lines.

  1. This is the footnote content. ↩

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Welcome! This guide will help you get started with your MkDocs documentation site.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
1. Clone this repository 

    git clone https://github.com/lucas3dspain/exampleDocs.git
cd exampleDocs

  2. Install dependencies 

    pip install -r requirements.txt

  3. Preview locally 

    mkdocs serve
    Open http://127.0.0.1:8000 in your browser.

  4. Start writing

  5. Edit files in the docs/ directory
  6. Update mkdocs.yml to add pages to navigation
  7. Commit and push to deploy!

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
exampleDocs/
├── docs/                    # Your documentation pages
│   ├── index.md            # Home page
│   ├── getting-started.md  # This file
│   └── examples.md         # Markdown examples
├── .github/
│   └── workflows/
│       └── ci.yml          # GitHub Actions workflow
├── mkdocs.yml              # MkDocs configuration
├── requirements.txt        # Python dependencies
└── README.md                # Project README

docs.title: Change Site Name
docs.text:
Edit mkdocs.yml: 

site_name: Your Site Name

docs.title: Add Pages
docs.text:
1. Create a new .md file in docs/
  2. Add it to the nav section in mkdocs.yml: 
    nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - Getting Started: getting-started.md
  - Your New Page: your-new-page.md

docs.title: Change Theme Colors
docs.text:
Edit the palette section in mkdocs.yml: 

palette:
  - scheme: default
    primary: blue  # Change this
    accent: blue   # Change this

docs.title: Deployment
docs.text:
The site automatically deploys to GitHub Pages when you push to the main branch.

To enable GitHub Pages:

  1. Go to your repository Settings
  2. Navigate to Pages
  3. Select "GitHub Actions" as the source

Your site will be available at: https://yourusername.github.io/exampleDocs/

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text:
• Check out the Examples page to see all available features
  • Read the MkDocs Documentation
  • Browse Material for MkDocs
